name: Salmon with Dijon Vinaigrette
author: DAGNYH
summary: White wine vinegar, Dijon mustard, and herbs make this a truly memorable way to cook salmon. I made it the other night and everyone said that it was the best fish they'd had!
ingredients: 1 tablespoon oil-packed sun-dried tomatoes, drained and sliced
freshly ground black pepper to taste
directions: In a shallow baking dish, mix the white wine vinegar, Dijon mustard, lemon juice, Italian seasoning, rosemary, tarragon, capers, and sun-dried tomatoes
Place the salmon fillets into the dish, and turn to coat with the marinade
Season with pepper, and sprinkle with olives
Preheat oven to 375  degrees F (190 degrees C)
Bake uncovered for 20 minutes in the preheated oven, or until fish is easily flaked with a fork
